page.title: 08FARMING 2.
page.content: Silage is cut, often by contractors, once or twice yearly and stored in polythene clamps or large sheds. Few farmers now cut the traditional hay. Remaining farmland is devoted to grain, potatoes and managed woodland. A few farmers rent winter grazing for upland sheep. The nearest{cattle markets}are at Chelford, near Macclesfield, and Beeston, near Tarporley. On the eastern border of the area is the Tabley Estate which surrounds Tabley House (now owned by Manchester University). Much of the estate land is let to tenant farmers in the area.
